articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il from Russian Fund President
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Russia
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Russian Fund President 
    Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The Supporters' Council of the Russian International Charity Fund "Protectors of the Art for the Century" decided to award order of the "Star of Protectors of the Arts", the supreme social citation of Russia, to Kim Il Sung, the eternal president of the DPRK, highly praising his fidelity to the idea of bona fides and justice and his feats for the cause of peace and the mental and moral treasure of humankind, preservation and development of national traditions and the development of the relations of cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia and carrying reverence for the great man and master of the times.
 In this connection O. V. Oleinik, president of the Russian International Charity Fund "Protectors of the Art for the Century", on Jan. 13 sent a letter to Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.    
 The letter said that a high degree of the patriotic spirit of the people in the DPRK and their boundless love for the country will never dry up but remain deep in the hearts of the rising generation thanks to the invincible Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung, the great leader and teacher.
 It requested Kim Jong Il who is a faithful and true successor to Kim Il Sung to receive the order of the "Star of Protectors of the Arts" symbolic of the eternal friendship of the Korean and Russian peoples.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to President of Slovakia
DPRK Ambassador to Thailand Appointed
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to President of Slovakia 
    Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Jan. 21 sent a message of sympathy to Ivan Gasparovic, president of the Slovak Republic, in connection with human losses caused by the crash of a plane in Slovakia.
 Upon hearing the sad news of the casualty, Kim in the message expressed deep condolences to the president and through him to the victims and their bereaved families.

articles.title: S. Korean Security Authorities' Crackdown Assailed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Thailand Appointed 
    Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- O Yong Son was appointed as DPRK ambassador e. p. to Thailand, according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Moves to Frame up "Liberal Teachers Union" Flailed
Koreans Called upon to Wage Three-point Patriotic Movement
DPRK Holidays to Be Observed in Cambodia
Joint New Year Editorial of DPRK Studied Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Holidays to Be Observed in Cambodia 
    Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Cambodian preparatory committee to commemorate the Day of the Sun and February 16 was inaugurated on Jan. 16.
 Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister and minister of the Royal Palace, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the instruction of Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni.    
 The preparatory committee discussed and decided to organize colorful functions such as film show and photo exhibition and widely introduce the undying exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il through publications on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and February 16.

articles.title: DPRK Policy on National Reunification Supported by Bosnia-Herzegovina
Rodong Sinmun on Cause of National Reunification
U.S. Ambassador's Reckless Remarks under Fire
National Sketch Contest of School Youth and Children Held
articles.content:
U.S. Ambassador's Reckless Remarks under Fire
    Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean journalist association issued a statement on Jan. 18 blasting the outcries made by the U.S. ambassador in Seoul, south Korean MBC reported.
  The statement accused the U.S. ambassador of again letting loose a string of balderdash that south Koreans should be concerned about the north regime.
  This is a sort of pressure on the north and, at the same time, an interference in the internal affairs of the south, it said, demanding the U.S. ambassador make an immediate apology for his remarks.    
 The U.S. ambassador would be well advised to refrain from making remarks getting on the nerves of the north, warned the statement.

articles.title: Ceremony of Presenting Electric Locomotive Held
Kim Jong Il's China Visit Hailed
Congratulations to Chilean President-Elect
KDWU Delegation Leaves for Uganda
articles.content:
Congratulations to Chilean President-Elect
    Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on January 16 sent a congratulatory message to Michelle Bachelet upon her election as Chilean president.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the days ahead, the message sincerely wished her success in her responsible work for the prosperity of the country.
